Tafsir Al-Ihya

Then recite the Surah, or the amount of three verses from the Qur'an or more, and do not connect the end of the Surah with the magnification of the *takbir* by separating between them with the amount of saying "Glory be to Allah [subhan Allah]." And recite in the dawn prayer [Fajr] from the long surahs of the *Mufassal*, and in the sunset prayer [Maghrib] from its short ones, and in the noon [Dhuhr], afternoon [Asr], and night [Isha] prayers, something similar to "By the sky containing constellations [al-sama'i dhati al-buruj]" and what is comparable to it. And in the dawn prayer during travel, "Say, 'O disbelievers [Qul ya ayyuha al-kafirun]'" and "Say, 'He is Allah, the One [Qul huwa Allahu ahad],'" and likewise in the two rak'ahs of the dawn [Fajr], the circumambulation [Tawaf], and the greeting [Tahiyyah]. And in all of that, he is persisting in the standing [qiyam] and the placement of the hands as we described at the beginning of the prayer.

a.g: He neither begets nor is born,
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
رواه عن النبي ﭬ أنه قال: (إن الله تعالى يمجد نفسه كل يوم ويقول إني أنا الله رب العالمين إني أنا الله لا إله إلا أنا الحي القيوم إني أنا الله لا إله إلا أنا العلي العظيم إني أنا الله لا إله إلا أنا لم ألد ولم أولد إني أنا الله لا إله إلا أنا العفو الغفور إني أنا الله لا إله إلا أنا مبدىء كل شيء وإلي يعود العزيز الحكيم الرحمن الرحيم مالك يوم الدين خالق الخير والشر خالق الجنة والنار الواحد الأحد الفرد الصمد الذي لم يتخذ صاحبة ولا ولدا الفرد الوتر عالم الغيب والشهادة الملك القدوس السلام المؤمن المهيمن العزيز الجبار المتكبر الخالق البارىء المصور الكبير المتعال المقتدر القهار الحليم الكريم أهل الثناء والمجد أعلم السر وأخفى القادر الرزاق فوق الخلق والخليقة[135]). وذكر قبل كل كلمة إني أنا الله لا إله إلا أنا كما أوردناه في الأول فمن دعا بهذه الأسماء فليقل إنك أنت الله لا إله إلا أنت كذا وكذا فمن دعا بهن كتب من الساجدين المخبتين الذين يجاورون محمدا وإبراهيم وموسى وعيسى والنبيين صلوات الله عليهم في دار الجلال وله ثواب العابدين في السموات والأرضين وصلى الله على محمد وعلى كل عبد مصطفى.
Indeed, it is narrated from the Prophet, peace be upon him, that he said: "Indeed, Allah the Exalted glorifies Himself every day and says: 'Indeed, I am Allah [Allah], Lord of the worlds [rabb al-'alamin]. Indeed, I am Allah [Allah], there is no god but I, the Ever-Living [al-Hayy], the Sustainer of existence [al-Qayyum]. Indeed, I am Allah [Allah], there is no god but I, the Most High [al-'Ali], the Most Great [al-'Azim]. Indeed, I am Allah [Allah], there is no god but I; I have not begotten, nor was I begotten. Indeed, I am Allah [Allah], there is no god but I, the Pardoner [al-'Afuw], the Forgiving [al-Ghafur]. Indeed, I am Allah [Allah], there is no god but I, the Originator of every thing, and to Me is the return, the Almighty [al-'Aziz], the Wise [al-Hakim], the Most Gracious [al-Rahman], the Most Merciful [al-Rahim], Master of the Day of Judgment [malik yawm al-din], Creator of good and evil, Creator of Paradise and the Fire, the One [al-Wahid], the Unique [al-Ahad], the Single [al-Fard], the Eternal [al-Samad] who has taken neither a consort nor a son, the Single [al-Fard], the One [al-Witr], Knower of the unseen and the witnessed [alim al-ghayb wa al-shahadah], the Sovereign [al-Malik], the Holy [al-Quddus], the Source of Peace [al-Salam], the Guardian of Faith [al-Mu'min], the Preserver [al-Muhaymin], the Almighty [al-'Aziz], the Compeller [al-Jabbar], the Supreme [al-Mutakabbir], the Creator [al-Khaliq], the Maker [al-Bari'], the Fashioner [al-Musawwir], the Most Great [al-Kabir], the Exalted [al-Muta'ali], the Omnipotent [al-Muqtadir], the Subduer [al-Qahhar], the Forbearing [al-Halim], the Generous [al-Karim], the Possessor of Praise and Glory [ahl al-thana' wa al-majd], Knower of the secret and what is more hidden, the All-Powerful [al-Qadir], the Provider [al-Razzaq], above the creation and the created.'" And He mentions before every phrase, "Indeed, I am Allah [Allah], there is no god but I," as we have presented it at the beginning. So whoever supplicates with these names, let him say, "Indeed, You are Allah [Allah], there is no god but You," such and such. For whoever supplicates with them, he is recorded among the prostrating, humble ones who will dwell alongside Muhammad, and Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus, and the prophets, the prayers of Allah be upon them, in the Abode of Majesty, and for him is the reward of the worshippers in the heavens and the earths. And may Allah send prayers upon Muhammad and upon every chosen servant.

a.g: Nor is there to Him any equivalent."
